items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: Summer
items.description: For dry roads and warm, arid climates

items.title: Performance
items.description: For sport/luxury vehicles and high-speed handling

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Sport
items.description: Sport Trucks typically feature a wide, low profile and offer drivers responsive handling and strong traction on paved roads.

items.title: UHP
items.description: Used on sports and super cars in warm weather, sporty handling, and quick acceleration

header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 245-70r16 drivers
Most popular among drivers in PA
Check out the sale price on this tire
Consistently rated as excellent by 245-70r16 drivers

content.body:
### Shop 245/70R16 Tire Size
245/70R16 is an older tire size that can be found on SUVs from the early 90s to the early 2010s. If you drive a Chevrolet Trailblazer, Dodge Dakota, Honda Passport, Isuzu Rodeo, Kia Sorento, or Toyota Sequoia, you might have 245/70R16 tires, and your ride might’ve left the factory with a set of BFGoodrich Open Trail T/A, Goodyear Wrangler SR-A, [Bridgestone Dueler H/T](https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/dueler-h-t), Michelin Latitude Tour, or Dunlop Grandtrek TG27 tires attached.

Popular vehicles
2002-2004 Chevrolet Trailblazer
2003-2010 Dodge Dakota
1994-2002 Honda Passport
1994-2004 Isuzu Rodeo
2003-2009 Kia Sorento
2001-2007 Toyota Sequoia

All-season tires are designed to perform in dry, wet, and light winter conditions, making them a popular choice for drivers. Consider the [Yokohama Geolandar H/T G056](https://simpletire.com/brands/yokohama-tires/geolandar-h-t-g056), Firestone Destination LE3, and GT Radial Savero HT2 if you need a set of 245/70R16 tires that can perform year-round.

Some drivers take their ride off-road from time to time, so they need a set of tires that are built to perform on any terrain. All-terrain tires are a great option for drivers who take their ride on- and off-road, and tires like the Pirelli Scorpion All Terrain Plus, Toyo Open Country A/T III, and [Hankook Dynapro AT2 Xtreme (RF12)](https://simpletire.com/brands/hankook-tires/dynapro-at2-xtreme-rf12) if you need extra traction and durability when driving off-road.

All-season tires are great for year-round traction and all-terrain tires can perform on- and off-road, but both tend to struggle in tough ice, slush, and snow. Fortunately, winter tires are engineered to provide consistent traction and grip in the toughest winter weather conditions. Take a look at the Continental VikingContact 7, Nokian Hakkapeliitta 10 SUV, and [Nexen Winguard Winspike WS62](https://simpletire.com/brands/nexen-tires/winguard-winspike-ws62) if you want better grip in ice, slush, and snow than an all-season or all-terrain tire can provide.

Whether you drive a Dodge Dakota, Honda Passport, Toyota Sequoia, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 245/70R16 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
